text:
The first Portland meeting of Tech Solidarity is this Tuesday at 7pm: <https://twitter.com/TechSolidarity/status/822575011567439874>
Anyone techie or non-techie is invited.

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/TechSolidarity|@TechSolidarity>: Our first tech solidarity event in Portland, OR will be on Tuesday, January 24, at 7 PM. Come in huge numbers! Ping me (see bio) for invite
attachments.text: Our first tech solidarity event in Portland, OR will be on Tuesday, January 24, at 7 PM. Come in huge numbers! Ping me (see bio) for invite

text:
> The goal of this meetup is to get interested people from the tech world together with Portland community organizations to discuss practical steps we can take in the face of a Trump administration, while there is still ample time to prepare and plan.
>  We'll operate on the assumption that Trump means what he says, and that he will work to implement the policies he campaigned on, including mass deportations, "extreme vetting" of immigrants and visitors, and a registry of Muslim Americans.
> Together I hope we can find ways to minimize the impact of these policies in and around Portland, help people defend their rights (and fight back), and lobby the companies we work to stop collecting and storing sensitive data wherever possible.
<!here|@here> does anyone know of any apps that center around group organization?  contact info, customizable list of interests, roll call

i've been asked to keep the contact list for the members of my local Citizens' Climate Lobby group...it's currently in a spreadsheet :disappointed:  As a SW dev I'm already envisioning an app :slightly_smiling_face:. Along with contact info, other interesting features could be attaching each member with their gov officials.  also connecting them with action items depending on their areas of interests, level of involvement
tax day march in the works to request Trump release his tax returns <http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/april-15-tax-day-trump-protest_us_58856577e4b0e3a73569f9ca>?

attachments.title: Activists Set Date For Next Big Anti-Trump Rallies
attachments.text: Gatherings will attempt to pressure the president into releasing his tax returns.
attachments.fallback: The Huffington Post: Activists Set Date For Next Big Anti-Trump Rallies

text: <!here|@here> still trying to understand the meat of this article...but sounds like there's some good research on how to combat the effects of fake news by "inoculating" people with how fact news is delivered, and by whom (if they are a credible source)...if i understand the article <http://www.ibtimes.com/fake-news-vaccine-climate-change-misinformation-can-be-fought-inoculation-scientists-2479360>

attachments.title: A Fake News Vaccine? Climate Change Misinformation Can Be Fought With ‘Inoculation,’ Scientists Say
attachments.text: Scientists have proposed a psychological “vaccine” against misinformation that will help inoculate the public against the damaging effects of misleading “myths.”
attachments.fallback: International Business Times: A Fake News Vaccine? Climate Change Misinformation Can Be Fought With ‘Inoculation,’ Scientists Say

text: It's already starting in my older kid's class - she had a 1-pager on how to verify an online source as legit, including how to do some basic research on the author's and publisher's credentials. Her class is taking this shit _seriously_. Gives me hope. :slightly_smiling_face:

text: <@U2X0KKTGT> <http://tools.bluestatedigital.com> and <https://civicrm.org> also exist but they are much more for organizational management than just like meetings?

attachments.title: Community Mobilization and Fundraising Platform | BSD Tools | Blue State Digital
attachments.text: The BSD Tools are designed to help you manage (and grow) inspiring, impactful digital programs - from fundraising to advocacy, communications to analytics.
attachments.fallback: Community Mobilization and Fundraising Platform | BSD Tools | Blue State Digital

text: I've used Blue State Digital before, it's functional (and the support is quite good, that's a big part of the price tag)
I would agree that BSD's toolset is more about mobilizing organizations and sending out targeted CTAs to massive lists of relevant people (supporters, donors, volunteers, The Media, The Government)
Nation Builder is going to be a game changer. Opening up voter cards to "anyone:, effectively removes 1 of the major levers of party control
